articles.title: The dark and sunny side of buying a home with solar panels
articles.description:
Realtors advise knowing what you’re getting into before making an offer.

The post The dark and sunny side of buying a home with solar panels appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Realtors warn Boston buyers to understand solar panel implications before making offers.
Homebuyers should consider potential savings and costs associated with solar installations.
Informed decisions can lead to better long-term financial outcomes for Boston homeowners.

articles.title: How to choose a real estate agent
articles.description:
Especially if you are buying your first home, go with a pro who matches your needs.

The post How to choose a real estate agent appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Choose a real estate agent who understands your specific needs when buying a home.
Consider agents with local expertise to navigate Boston's competitive housing market effectively.
Selecting the right agent can streamline the home-buying process for first-time Boston buyers.

articles.title: 5 can’t-miss restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston this week
articles.description:
Stay up to date on the best new restaurants, recent openings, and the biggest dining updates across Greater Boston's food scene.

The post 5 can’t-miss restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston this week appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Five new restaurants opened in Greater Boston this week, enhancing local dining options.
Notable openings include 'The Greenhouse' and 'Seafood Haven' as of September 11, 2025.
These additions aim to boost local economy and provide diverse culinary experiences for residents.

articles.title: Renters band together to protect their rights
articles.description:
Tenant support organizations help navigate the system when apartments aren’t up to snuff.

The post Renters band together to protect their rights appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Tenant support organizations assist Boston renters with substandard living conditions.
Over 30 local groups are collaborating to advocate for tenant rights.
Increased awareness leads to better living conditions for Boston's renters.
